chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: Rbar
x: Rbar

Goal:
Rbar_lt (Rbar_abs x) y <-> Rbar_lt (Rbar_opp y) x /\ Rbar_lt x y

Premises:
Rbar_lt = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite y0 => x0 < y0 | p_infty => True | m_infty => False end | p_infty => False | m_infty => match y with | m_infty => False | _ => True end end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_abs = fun x : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => Finite (Rabs x0) | _ => p_infty end : Rbar -> Rbar
Rbar_opp = fun x : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => Finite (- x0) | p_infty => m_infty | m_infty => p_infty end : Rbar -> Rbar
Rbar_opp_lt : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) < -> Rbar_lt y x
Rbar_lt_locally : forall (a b : Rbar) (x : R), Rbar_lt a x -> Rbar_lt x b -> exists delta : posreal, forall y : R, Rabs (y - x) < delta -> Rbar_lt a y /\ Rbar_lt y b
Rbar_lt_trans : forall x y z : Rbar, Rbar_lt x y -> Rbar_lt y z -> Rbar_lt x z
Rbar_mult_pos_lt : forall (x y : Rbar) (z : posreal), Rbar_lt x y < -> Rbar_lt (Rbar_mult_pos x z) (Rbar_mult_pos y z)
Rbar_div_pos_lt : forall (x y : Rbar) (z : posreal), Rbar_lt x y < -> Rbar_lt (Rbar_div_pos x z) (Rbar_div_pos y z)
Rbar_opp_le : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) < -> Rbar_le y x
Rbar_lt_le_trans : forall x y z : Rbar, Rbar_lt x y -> Rbar_le y z -> Rbar_lt x z
Rbar_le_lt_trans : forall x y z : Rbar, Rbar_le x y -> Rbar_lt y z -> Rbar_lt x z
Rbar_plus_opp : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_plus (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) = Rbar_opp (Rbar_plus x y)
ex_Rbar_plus_opp : forall x y : Rbar, ex_Rbar_plus x y -> ex_Rbar_plus (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y)
Rbar_mult_opp : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_mult (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) = Rbar_mult x y
Rbar_plus_lt_compat : forall a b c d : Rbar, Rbar_lt a b -> Rbar_lt c d -> Rbar_lt (Rbar_plus a c) (Rbar_plus b d)
Rbar_lt_le : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt x y -> Rbar_le x y
Rbar_lt_not_eq : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt x y -> x <> y
Rbar_lt_not_le : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt y x -> ~ Rbar_le x y
Rbar_le_not_lt : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le y x -> ~ Rbar_lt x y
Rbar_not_le_lt : forall x y : Rbar, ~ Rbar_le x y -> Rbar_lt y x
Rbar_not_lt_le : forall x y : Rbar, ~ Rbar_lt x y -> Rbar_le y x
Rbar_lt_dec : forall x y : Rbar, {Rbar_lt x y} + {~ Rbar_lt x y}
Rbar_mult_opp_l : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_mult (Rbar_opp x) y = Rbar_opp (Rbar_mult x y)
is_Rbar_mult_m_infty_pos : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_lt 0 x -> is_Rbar_mult m_infty x m_infty
is_Rbar_mult_p_infty_pos : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_lt 0 x -> is_Rbar_mult p_infty x p_infty
is_Rbar_mult_p_infty_neg : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_lt x 0 -> is_Rbar_mult p_infty x m_infty
is_Rbar_mult_m_infty_neg : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_lt x 0 -> is_Rbar_mult m_infty x p_infty
is_Rbar_mult_opp_l : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_mult x y z -> is_Rbar_mult (Rbar_opp x) y (Rbar_opp z)
ex_Rbar_mult_opp_l : forall x y : Rbar, ex_Rbar_mult x y -> ex_Rbar_mult (Rbar_opp x) y
is_Rbar_mult_opp_r : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_mult x y z -> is_Rbar_mult x (Rbar_opp y) (Rbar_opp z)
Rbar_mult_opp_r : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_mult x (Rbar_opp y) = Rbar_opp (Rbar_mult x y)
ex_Rbar_mult_opp_r : forall x y : Rbar, ex_Rbar_mult x y -> ex_Rbar_mult x (Rbar_opp y)
Rbar_inv_opp : forall x : Rbar, x <> 0 -> Rbar_inv (Rbar_opp x) = Rbar_opp (Rbar_inv x)
